symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Loss of reverse can be caused by low fluid, a failed solenoid, or internal clutch damage. We'll need to inspect fluid level, scan for codes, and test hydraulic pressure.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check fluid level and condition first
• Scan for P0708-P0709 (range sensor) or solenoid codes
• Test reverse clutch pressure if accessible
• Manual: check linkage and synchro

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: When the car won't move forward, it's often low fluid, a failed pump, or internal damage. Diagnosis includes fluid check, code scan, and pressure testing.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Verify park pawl isn't stuck
• Check fluid level and pump operation
• Scan for P0700 series codes
• Listen for pump whine or grinding

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A delay when shifting into drive or reverse can indicate low fluid, worn clutches, or valve body issues. We'll check fluid condition and scan for transmission codes.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Note delay duration (1-2 sec vs 3+ sec)
• Check fluid level and color
• Scan for solenoid or pressure codes
• May need fluid exchange or valve body service

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Harsh shifts can be caused by low fluid, a faulty solenoid, or software issues. Diagnosis includes fluid check, code scan, and test drive.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Note which shifts are harsh (1-2, 2-3, etc.)
• Check for adaptive learning reset needs
• Scan for shift solenoid codes
• Verify throttle position sensor data

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Slipping means the transmission isn't holding gear properly. This can be low fluid, worn clutches, or internal damage. We'll check fluid and scan for codes to assess severity.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Note which gear(s) slip
• Check fluid level and burn smell
• Scan for P0730-P0734 (gear ratio codes)
• Slipping under load = internal wear

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Stuck in limp mode / 3rd gear only
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Limp mode locks the transmission in one gear to prevent damage. It's triggered by sensor faults, solenoid issues, or low fluid. We'll scan codes to find the root cause.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for P0700, P0868 (pressure), solenoid codes
• Check fluid level and condition
• Verify wiring harness and connectors
• May need solenoid replacement or TCM reflash

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A whining noise can indicate low fluid, a failing pump, or bearing wear. We'll check fluid level and listen to pinpoint the source.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Note if whine changes with RPM or speed
• Check fluid level first
• Pump whine = low fluid or pump failure
• Bearing whine = internal damage

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Grinding or clunking suggests internal damage, worn gears, or a failing torque converter. We'll inspect and listen to determine if repair or replacement is needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Manual: check clutch and synchros
• Auto: check torque converter and flex plate
• Note when noise occurs (shifting, coasting, etc.)
• May need transmission removal

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Transmission leaks can come from seals, gaskets, or cooler lines. We'll locate the leak source and provide a repair estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check pan gasket, axle seals, cooler lines
• Use UV dye if leak is slow
• Note fluid color and smell
• Top off fluid after repair

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Overheating can damage the transmission quickly. Causes include low fluid, a clogged cooler, or excessive load. We'll check fluid, cooler flow, and scan for codes.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for temp sensor codes
• Check fluid level and condition
• Inspect cooler lines and radiator trans cooler
• Towing or heavy load history?

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Shuddering during acceleration often points to torque converter lockup issues or worn clutches. We'll test drive and scan for codes to identify the cause.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Common in CVTs and torque converter lockup
• Check for TSBs on shudder
• Scan for P0741 (TCC stuck off)
• Fluid exchange may help if caught early

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Shifter won't move out of park
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the shifter is stuck in park, it's usually the brake light switch, shift interlock solenoid, or a fuse. We'll test the brake switch and interlock system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Test brake light switch first
• Check shift interlock solenoid
• Verify brake lights work
• Check fuses and wiring

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Stuck in one gear / won't shift
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Being stuck in one gear can be a sensor fault, solenoid failure, or mechanical issue. We'll scan for codes and test the shift system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for range sensor, solenoid codes
• Check manual linkage if applicable
• Verify TCM communication
• May be limp mode or mechanical failure

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Random or erratic shifts can be caused by sensor issues, solenoid faults, or software glitches. We'll scan codes and test drive to diagnose.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for speed sensor, TPS, solenoid codes
• Check for software updates or TSBs
• Verify wiring and connectors
• May need adaptive reset

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Clunk when shifting into drive or reverse
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A clunk when shifting can be worn motor mounts, U-joints, or internal transmission wear. We'll inspect mounts and drivetrain components.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check engine and trans mounts first
• Inspect U-joints and CV axles
• Note if clunk is worse when cold
• May be normal for some vehicles

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A burning smell indicates overheated or contaminated fluid, or internal clutch damage. We'll check fluid condition and scan for overheating codes.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check fluid color and smell immediately
• Burnt fluid = internal damage likely
• Scan for temp and pressure codes
• May need fluid flush or rebuild

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Check engine light with transmission issue
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Transmission-related check engine lights can indicate sensor faults, solenoid issues, or gear ratio problems. We'll scan codes to identify the specific issue.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for P0700-P0799 (transmission codes)
• Note pending vs confirmed codes
• Check freeze frame data
• May need test drive to replicate

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: CVT judder is common and can be caused by worn belts, contaminated fluid, or software issues. We'll check fluid and scan for CVT-specific codes.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check for CVT fluid TSBs and updates
• Scan for belt slip codes
• CVT fluid is specific - don't mix types
• May need fluid exchange or software update

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Hard shifting in a manual can be clutch, linkage, or synchro issues. We'll test the clutch and inspect the linkage.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check clutch pedal free play
• Inspect shift linkage and bushings
• Test clutch hydraulics if applicable
• Note which gears are hard to engage

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Grinding during shifts indicates worn synchros, clutch issues, or damaged gears. We'll test the clutch and assess internal damage.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Note which gears grind
• Check clutch adjustment and hydraulics
• Grinding into reverse = synchro or clutch
• May need transmission rebuild

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Clutch slipping means it's not fully engaging. This is usually a worn clutch disc or pressure plate. We'll test and provide a replacement estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Test clutch engagement point
• Check for oil contamination on disc
• Inspect flywheel for hot spots
• Replace clutch kit as assembly

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Clutch chatter can be caused by oil contamination, worn mounts, or a damaged pressure plate. We'll inspect the clutch and mounts.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check engine and trans mounts
• Inspect for oil leaks onto clutch
• Test clutch engagement smoothness
• May need clutch replacement or mount repair

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Torque converter shudder feels like driving over rumble strips at low speeds. It's often caused by worn lockup clutch or contaminated fluid. We'll test drive and check fluid.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Common at 30-45 mph light throttle
• Check for TSBs on shudder fix
• Scan for P0741 (TCC)
• Fluid exchange may resolve if caught early

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the transmission won't downshift for passing, it could be a throttle sensor, kickdown cable, or software issue. We'll scan codes and test the throttle system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check throttle position sensor data
• Verify kickdown cable adjustment (older vehicles)
• Scan for TPS or shift logic codes
• May need adaptive reset or software update

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Shift flare / RPM spike between gears
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Shift flare is when RPMs spike briefly between shifts. This indicates slipping clutches or low line pressure. We'll check fluid and scan for codes.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Note which shifts flare (1-2, 2-3, etc.)
• Check fluid level and condition
• Scan for pressure and solenoid codes
• Early sign of internal wear

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Transmission drops into neutral while driving
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the transmission randomly drops into neutral, it's a serious safety issue. Causes include sensor faults, solenoid failures, or internal damage. Immediate diagnosis required.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for range sensor, solenoid codes
• Check wiring harness and connectors
• Verify TCM communication
• Safety concern - prioritize diagnosis

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Loud clunk when shifting into reverse
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A clunk into reverse can be normal for some vehicles, or indicate worn mounts or internal wear. We'll inspect mounts and test the transmission.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check engine and trans mounts
• Note if clunk is worse when cold
• Some clunk is normal on certain models
• Inspect U-joints and drivetrain

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Gear hunting means the transmission can't decide which gear to use. This can be sensor issues, software problems, or torque converter faults. We'll scan codes and test drive.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Scan for speed sensor, TPS codes
• Check for software updates
• Verify torque converter lockup operation
• May need adaptive reset

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Cold shift issues can be normal or indicate thick/contaminated fluid or worn components. We'll check fluid condition and test when cold.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check fluid type and condition
• Some cold shift delay is normal
• Scan for temp sensor codes
• May need fluid exchange

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Problems that appear when hot suggest overheating, worn seals, or internal wear. We'll check fluid, cooling system, and scan for temp codes.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes:
• Check trans cooler and lines
• Scan for temp sensor codes
• Inspect fluid level and condition
• Hot issues = internal wear likely

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Alternator not charging / battery light on
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the alternator isn't charging, the battery will drain and the car will stall. We'll test the charging system to confirm the alternator, battery, or wiring.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Test battery voltage at idle and 2000 RPM. Should see 13.8-14.4V charging. Check belt tension and alternator connections. Scan for charging system codes.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A parasitic drain means something is drawing power when the car is off. We'll test the battery and use a multimeter to find the circuit causing the drain.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Test battery health first. Measure draw with multimeter (should be under 50mA). Pull fuses one by one to isolate circuit. Common: interior lights, radio, alarm, modules not sleeping.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Clicking usually means low battery voltage or a failing starter. We'll test the battery and starter circuit to determine which needs replacement.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Test battery voltage under load. Check starter connections and ground. Tap starter with hammer while cranking to test for stuck solenoid. May need starter replacement.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: No crank, no click, no sound
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: No sound at all usually means no power to the starter. This can be a dead battery, bad connection, ignition switch, or security system issue.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check battery voltage first. Test ignition switch, neutral safety switch, clutch switch. Check starter relay and fuses. Scan for security system codes.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Power window issues can be a bad switch, motor, regulator, or wiring. We'll test the circuit to find the cause.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check fuses first. Test switch with multimeter. Check for power at motor. Listen for motor noise. May need window regulator or motor replacement.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Central locking / key fob not working
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Key fob or central locking issues can be a dead fob battery, faulty actuator, or module problem. We'll diagnose the system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Replace fob battery first. Test door lock actuators. Scan for body control module codes. Check for broken wires in door jamb.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Flickering lights can indicate a failing alternator, loose battery connection, or bad ground. We'll test the charging system and connections.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Test alternator output and ripple. Check battery terminals and ground connections. Inspect alternator belt. May need alternator or voltage regulator.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Non-working headlights are a safety hazard. This can be bulbs, fuses, relay, or switch. We'll test the circuit to find the issue.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check bulbs and fuses first. Test headlight relay and switch. Check for power at bulb sockets. Inspect wiring for damage.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A non-working horn can be the horn itself, the relay, or the clock spring in the steering wheel. We'll test the circuit.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check fuse and relay first. Test horn directly with power. Check clock spring continuity. May need horn or clock spring replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Wiper issues can be the motor, switch, relay, or linkage. We'll diagnose the system to find the cause.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check fuse and relay. Test wiper motor with power. Inspect linkage for binding. Check wiper switch. May need motor or linkage.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Fuel pump not priming / no fuel pressure
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the fuel pump doesn't prime, the engine won't start. This can be the pump, relay, fuse, or wiring. We'll test fuel pressure and the pump circuit.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for pump prime on key-on. Test fuel pressure. Check fuel pump relay and fuse. Test power at pump connector. May need pump or relay.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Non-working gauges can be a cluster issue, sensor problem, or wiring fault. We'll scan for codes and test the system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for cluster and sensor codes. Check fuses. Test sensor signals with scan tool. May need cluster repair or sensor replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: An ABS light indicates a fault in the anti-lock brake system. This can be a wheel speed sensor, module, or wiring issue. We'll scan codes to diagnose.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for ABS codes. Common: wheel speed sensors, tone rings, wiring damage. Test sensor resistance and signals. May need sensor or module.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: An airbag light means the airbag system has a fault and may not deploy in a crash. We'll scan codes to identify the issue.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for airbag codes. Common: clock spring, seat belt pretensioner, impact sensor, wiring. Handle with care - airbags can deploy.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Traction control / stability control light on
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Traction control lights can indicate wheel speed sensor issues, steering angle sensor faults, or system malfunctions. We'll scan codes to diagnose.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for traction control and ABS codes. Check wheel speed sensors and steering angle sensor. May need sensor calibration or replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Overheating can cause severe engine damage. Common causes are low coolant, thermostat failure, radiator issues, or water pump failure. We'll diagnose the cooling system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check coolant level and condition. Pressure test system for leaks. Test thermostat operation. Check radiator flow and fan operation. Scan for temp sensor codes.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Coolant leaks can come from hoses, radiator, water pump, or head gasket. We'll pressure test the system to locate the leak.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Pressure test cooling system. Use UV dye if needed. Check hoses, radiator, water pump, heater core, head gasket. Note coolant color and level.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the radiator fan doesn't run, the engine will overheat in traffic or at idle. This can be the fan motor, relay, fuse, or temperature sensor.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Test fan motor directly. Check fan relay and fuse. Scan for temp sensor codes. Test coolant temp sensor. May need fan motor or relay.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A stuck thermostat causes overheating (stuck closed) or slow warm-up and poor heat (stuck open). We'll test the thermostat operation.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check engine temp with scan tool. Feel upper and lower radiator hoses. Stuck closed = overheating; stuck open = slow warm-up. Replace thermostat.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A failing water pump can leak coolant or cause overheating. We'll inspect the pump for leaks and bearing noise.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for coolant leak at weep hole. Listen for bearing noise or grinding. Check for play in pulley. May need timing belt replacement if internal pump.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: No heat can be caused by low coolant, a stuck thermostat, clogged heater core, or blend door issue. We'll diagnose the heating system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check coolant level. Test thermostat operation. Feel heater hoses for temp. Check blend door operation. May need heater core flush or blend door actuator.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A clogged radiator restricts coolant flow and causes overheating. We'll test coolant flow and inspect the radiator.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for temp difference across radiator with IR gun. Pressure test system. Check for external blockage (bugs, debris). May need radiator replacement or flush.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Head gasket leak / coolant in oil
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A blown head gasket can cause overheating, white smoke, coolant loss, or milky oil. This is a serious issue requiring immediate diagnosis.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for white smoke, milky oil, coolant loss. Pressure test system. Use block tester for combustion gases in coolant. May need head gasket replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Boiling coolant indicates severe overheating or combustion gases entering the cooling system. This requires immediate diagnosis to prevent engine damage.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for head gasket failure with block tester. Pressure test system. Check radiator cap. Test thermostat. Do not remove cap when hot.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A burst or leaking hose will cause coolant loss and overheating. We'll inspect all hoses and replace any that are damaged or deteriorated.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect all coolant hoses for cracks, bulges, soft spots. Check clamps. Pressure test after replacement. Replace hoses in pairs if old.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A non-working temp gauge can be a faulty sensor, gauge, or wiring. We'll test the sensor and circuit.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for temp sensor codes. Test sensor resistance. Check gauge with scan tool data. May need coolant temp sensor or cluster repair.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A leaking heater core causes coolant smell, foggy windows, and wet carpet. We'll pressure test to confirm and provide a replacement estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for sweet smell, wet passenger carpet, foggy windows. Pressure test cooling system. Heater core replacement is labor-intensive on most vehicles.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Clunking over bumps can be worn struts, control arms, sway bar links, or ball joints. We'll inspect the suspension components.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect struts, control arm bushings, sway bar links, ball joints. Check for play and torn boots. Test drive over bumps. Common: sway bar links, strut mounts.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A bouncy ride usually indicates worn shocks or struts. We'll inspect the suspension and test the dampers.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Bounce test each corner. Inspect struts/shocks for leaks. Check for worn bushings. May need struts or shocks replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Steering wheel vibration can be caused by unbalanced wheels, bent rims, worn tie rods, or brake issues. We'll diagnose the cause.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Note speed when vibration occurs. Check wheel balance and runout. Inspect tie rods and ball joints. Check brake rotors for warping.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Pulling to one side can be caused by alignment issues, uneven tire pressure, brake problems, or suspension damage. We'll diagnose the cause.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check tire pressure first. Test drive to confirm pull. Inspect for brake drag. Check alignment. May need alignment or suspension repair.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Uneven tire wear indicates alignment issues, worn suspension parts, or improper tire pressure. We'll inspect and recommend corrections.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Note wear pattern (inside, outside, cupping, feathering). Check alignment. Inspect ball joints, tie rods, control arms. May need alignment or parts.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Loose steering can be caused by worn tie rods, ball joints, steering rack, or alignment issues. This is a safety concern requiring immediate inspection.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check steering wheel play. Inspect tie rod ends, ball joints, steering rack. Check for play in steering components. May need tie rods or rack.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Hard steering can be caused by low power steering fluid, a failing pump, or steering rack issues. We'll diagnose the power steering system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check power steering fluid level and condition. Listen for pump noise. Test steering effort. Check for leaks. May need pump or rack.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Power steering leaks can come from hoses, pump, or rack. We'll locate the leak and provide a repair estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check fluid level and color. Inspect hoses, pump, rack for leaks. Use UV dye if needed. Common: rack seals, high pressure hose.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Squeaking when turning can be worn ball joints, tie rods, or strut mounts. We'll inspect the steering and suspension components.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Turn wheels while stationary to isolate noise. Check ball joints, tie rods, strut mounts. Lubricate if applicable. May need ball joints or mounts.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Worn ball joints can cause clunking, loose steering, and uneven tire wear. Severe wear is a safety hazard. We'll inspect and replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for play with pry bar. Inspect boots for tears. Load-bearing vs non-load-bearing test procedures differ. Replace in pairs.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Worn control arm bushings cause clunking, poor handling, and alignment issues. We'll inspect and replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect bushings for cracks, tears, separation. Check for play. May need control arm or bushing replacement. Alignment required after.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Worn sway bar links cause clunking over bumps. This is a common wear item and relatively simple to replace.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for play in sway bar links. Listen for clunking over bumps. Replace in pairs. No alignment needed.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Worn strut mounts cause clunking and poor steering response. We'll inspect the mounts and replace if needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for clunking when turning or over bumps. Inspect strut mount bearings. May need strut mount replacement. Alignment recommended after.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Misalignment causes uneven tire wear, pulling, and off-center steering. We'll perform a four-wheel alignment.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check tire wear pattern. Inspect suspension for damage before aligning. Adjust camber, caster, toe as needed. Test drive after.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Tie rod ends worn or loose
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Worn tie rods cause loose steering, vibration, and alignment issues. This is a safety concern. We'll inspect and replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for play in tie rod ends. Inspect boots. Test for vertical and horizontal play. Replace and align. Safety critical component.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Clicking when turning indicates a worn CV axle joint. We'll inspect the axle boots and joints and replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Turn wheels full lock and drive slowly. Clicking = outer CV joint worn. Check boots for tears and grease leakage. Replace axle.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A torn CV boot allows grease to leak out and dirt to enter, causing joint failure. Early replacement can save the axle.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect all CV boots for tears. If caught early, boot replacement may work. If joint is clicking, replace axle. Check both sides.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Differential noise can indicate worn gears or bearings. We'll inspect the differential and check fluid level and condition.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Note when noise occurs (acceleration, deceleration, turning). Check diff fluid level and condition. Listen for bearing or gear noise. May need rebuild.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Differential leaks can come from seals, gaskets, or pinion seal. We'll locate the leak and provide a repair estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for leaks at pinion seal, axle seals, cover gasket. Note fluid level and condition. Replace seals and top off fluid.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Transfer case noise can indicate low fluid, worn bearings, or chain issues. We'll inspect and check fluid level.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check transfer case fluid level and condition. Listen for grinding or whining. Test 4WD engagement. May need fluid service or rebuild.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Driveshaft vibration can be caused by worn U-joints, bent shaft, or balance issues. We'll inspect the driveshaft components.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check U-joints for play and rust. Inspect driveshaft for damage or missing balance weights. Check center bearing if equipped. Replace U-joints or shaft.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Worn U-joints cause clunking when accelerating or decelerating. Failure can cause driveshaft separation. We'll inspect and replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for play in U-joints. Look for rust or seized joints. Clunk on acceleration/deceleration = worn U-joint. Replace as needed.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Wheel bearing noise is a humming or growling that changes with speed. Worn bearings are a safety hazard. We'll inspect and replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for humming that changes with speed. Check for play in wheel bearing. Note which side is louder. Replace bearing assembly.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: 4WD engagement issues can be electrical, vacuum, or mechanical. We'll diagnose the transfer case and engagement system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for 4WD codes. Test actuator operation. Check vacuum lines if applicable. Inspect transfer case fluid. May need actuator or module.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: AWD warning lights can indicate system faults, mismatched tires, or component failures. We'll scan codes to diagnose.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for AWD codes. Check tire sizes and pressures. Inspect transfer case fluid. Common: actuator, coupling, control module.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Center support bearing noise is a rumbling or squeaking from under the car. We'll inspect the bearing and replace if worn.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for rumbling or squeaking from center of driveshaft. Check bearing for play or roughness. Replace center bearing assembly.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Axle seal leaks cause gear oil to leak onto brakes and wheels. We'll replace the seal and check fluid level.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check for oil on wheel or brake. Inspect axle seal. Replace seal and top off differential fluid. Clean brake components if contaminated.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: AC issues can be low refrigerant, compressor failure, or electrical problems. We'll diagnose the AC system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check AC pressures. Test compressor engagement. Scan for AC codes. Check for leaks with UV dye. May need recharge, compressor, or leak repair.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: AC leaks cause loss of cooling. We'll use UV dye or electronic leak detection to locate the leak and provide a repair estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check AC pressures. Use UV dye or electronic sniffer. Common leaks: condenser, evaporator, hose connections, compressor seal.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: AC compressor noise can indicate bearing failure or internal damage. We'll inspect the compressor and system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for grinding, squealing, or rattling from compressor. Check clutch operation. Test AC pressures. May need compressor replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: No air flow can be a bad blower motor, resistor, or fuse. We'll diagnose the blower circuit.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check fuse and relay. Test blower motor with direct power. Check blower resistor or control module. May need motor or resistor.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Blend door stuck / no temp control
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Stuck blend doors prevent temperature control. This can be a failed actuator or broken door. We'll diagnose the HVAC system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for clicking from dash when changing temp. Scan for HVAC codes. Test actuator operation. May need actuator or dash removal for door repair.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: If the AC clutch doesn't engage, the compressor won't run. This can be electrical, low refrigerant, or a bad clutch. We'll diagnose the issue.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check AC pressures. Test clutch coil with multimeter. Check AC relay and fuse. Test pressure switches. May need clutch, relay, or recharge.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A clogged heater core restricts coolant flow and reduces heat output. We'll test the heater core and flush or replace as needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Feel heater hoses for temp difference. Flush heater core. If no improvement, may need heater core replacement (labor-intensive).

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Cabin air filter clogged / weak airflow
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A clogged cabin filter reduces airflow and can cause odors. We'll replace the cabin air filter.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect cabin filter. Replace if dirty or clogged. Simple maintenance item. Improves airflow and air quality.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Evaporator leaks are inside the dash and cause AC failure. This is a labor-intensive repair requiring dash removal.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check AC pressures. Use electronic leak detector. Evaporator replacement requires dash removal. Very labor-intensive repair.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Condenser damage from road debris causes AC leaks. We'll inspect the condenser and provide a replacement estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect condenser for damage or leaks. Common from road debris. Check AC pressures. Replace condenser and recharge system.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Musty AC smells are caused by mold or bacteria on the evaporator. We'll clean the evaporator and replace the cabin filter.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Replace cabin filter. Use evaporator cleaner spray. Run AC on high with cleaner. May need multiple treatments.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: AC freezing can be caused by low refrigerant, restricted airflow, or a bad expansion valve. We'll diagnose the AC system.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check AC pressures. Inspect cabin filter and evaporator. Test expansion valve or orifice tube. May need recharge or component replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Emissions-related check engine lights can be O2 sensors, catalytic converter, EVAP system, or other emissions components. We'll scan codes to diagnose.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for codes. Common: P0420/P0430 (cat), P0171/P0174 (lean), P0440-P0456 (EVAP), P0130-P0167 (O2 sensors). Check freeze frame data.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Catalytic converter failure causes check engine light and may affect performance. We'll diagnose to confirm the cat is bad and not another issue.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for P0420/P0430. Check O2 sensor data. Test cat temp with IR gun. Rule out O2 sensors, exhaust leaks, engine issues before replacing cat.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Failed O2 sensors cause check engine light and poor fuel economy. We'll scan codes and test the sensors.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for O2 sensor codes (P0130-P0167). Check sensor data with scan tool. Replace failed sensor. Common wear item.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: EVAP leaks are fuel vapor leaks that trigger check engine light. We'll use a smoke machine to locate the leak.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for EVAP codes (P0440-P0456). Use smoke machine to find leak. Common: gas cap, purge valve, vent valve, hoses, canister.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Exhaust leaks cause loud noise and can affect emissions and performance. We'll locate the leak and provide a repair estimate.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for exhaust leak. Inspect manifold, pipes, muffler, flex pipe. Check for rust or damage. May need manifold gasket, pipe, or muffler.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Rusted or damaged mufflers cause loud exhaust noise. We'll inspect and replace the muffler.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect muffler for rust holes or damage. Check hangers and pipes. Replace muffler and any damaged pipes.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Exhaust manifold leaks cause ticking noise and can trigger check engine light. We'll inspect the manifold and gaskets.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Listen for ticking that increases with RPM. Inspect manifold for cracks. Check gaskets. May need manifold or gasket replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: Broken flex pipes cause loud exhaust noise and vibration. We'll inspect and replace the flex pipe.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Inspect flex pipe for cracks or separation. Common failure point. Replace flex pipe section or entire pipe.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: EGR valve issues cause rough idle, stalling, or check engine light. We'll test the EGR system and clean or replace the valve.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for EGR codes. Test EGR valve operation. Check for carbon buildup. May need cleaning or replacement.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A failed PCV valve can cause rough idle, oil consumption, or oil leaks. We'll replace the PCV valve.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Check PCV valve for rattling. Replace if stuck or clogged. Simple maintenance item. Check hoses for cracks.

symptom_mappings.symptom_label: Gas cap loose or missing / P0457
symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A loose or damaged gas cap triggers check engine light. We'll inspect and replace the gas cap if needed.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for P0457 or EVAP large leak codes. Inspect gas cap seal. Replace if damaged. Clear codes and test.

symptom_mappings.customer_explainer: A saturated or damaged charcoal canister causes EVAP codes and fuel smell. We'll diagnose and replace the canister.
symptom_mappings.mechanic_notes: Scan for EVAP codes. Check for fuel smell. Inspect canister for damage or saturation. Replace canister and check purge valve.

symptom_questions.question_label: Do all forward gears work normally?
options: No, some forward gears also slip or don't work
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Isolates reverse-only failure vs broader internal damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the transmission fluid level?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low fluid is the most common cause and quickest fix

symptom_questions.question_label: Did this happen suddenly or gradually?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Sudden = solenoid or sensor; gradual = clutch wear

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear any grinding or clunking when trying to shift into reverse?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Noise indicates mechanical damage vs hydraulic/electrical issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine or transmission warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms if TCM has stored diagnostic codes

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the shifter move through all positions (P, R, N, D)?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines if issue is linkage vs internal transmission

symptom_questions.question_label: Does reverse gear work?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Reverse working = forward clutch issue; both out = pump or major failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear the engine rev but the car doesn't move?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms transmission isn't engaging vs engine/drivetrain issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the transmission fluid?
options: Yes, it's very low or empty
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Empty fluid = leak or catastrophic failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Can the vehicle be safely towed or does it need a flatbed?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines towing method and urgency

symptom_questions.question_label: How long is the delay before the transmission engages?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Longer delays indicate more severe wear or low pressure

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gear has the delay?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Isolates which clutch pack or circuit is affected

symptom_questions.question_label: When does the delay happen?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Cold = fluid viscosity; hot = seal wear; always = low fluid or pump

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the delay getting worse over time?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Progressive worsening indicates internal wear vs stable issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Which shifts feel harsh?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies specific solenoid or clutch pack involved

symptom_questions.question_label: Is it harsh when upshifting, downshifting, or both?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Narrows solenoid or valve body issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Was there recent transmission service or fluid change?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Wrong fluid or overfill can cause harsh shifts

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms stored codes for solenoid or sensor faults

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gear slips?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies specific clutch pack failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you see the RPMs spike or flare when it slips?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms clutch slip vs torque converter issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it slip more under heavy acceleration or going uphill?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Slipping under load = severe internal wear

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the transmission fluid smell burnt?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Burnt fluid confirms internal clutch damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you still drive the vehicle safely?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and whether towing is needed

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gear is it stuck in?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms limp mode vs mechanical failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine or transmission warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Limp mode always triggers warning light with stored codes

symptom_questions.question_label: When did this start?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent onset suggests triggering event or new fault

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you tried turning the car off and back on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Persistent limp mode = hard fault; clears = intermittent issue

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you hear the whining?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Constant = pump; moving = bearings; shifting = clutch

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the pitch of the whine change with engine RPM or vehicle speed?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: RPM = pump/torque converter; speed = output shaft/bearings

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the transmission fluid level?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low fluid is the most common cause of pump whine

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you record the whining noise?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Audio helps distinguish pump whine from bearing noise

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you hear the grinding?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing isolates gears vs torque converter vs bearings

symptom_questions.question_label: Is this a manual or automatic transmission?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Manual = clutch/synchros; automatic = torque converter/gears

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you feel vibration along with the grinding?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Vibration suggests severe mechanical damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you record the grinding noise?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Audio helps assess severity and source

symptom_questions.question_label: Where do you see the leak?
options: Under the center of the car
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Location helps identify pan gasket vs axle seals vs cooler lines

symptom_questions.question_label: How much fluid is leaking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and whether driving is safe

symptom_questions.question_label: What color is the fluid?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms transmission fluid vs other fluids

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you take a photo of the leak or puddle?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Visual helps confirm fluid type and leak severity

symptom_questions.question_label: Is there a transmission temperature warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms overheating vs suspected overheating

symptom_questions.question_label: What symptoms are you experiencing?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Multiple symptoms indicate severe overheating damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you been towing or driving in heavy traffic?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Heavy load or stop-and-go increases heat generation

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the transmission fluid level?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low fluid causes overheating and pump damage

symptom_questions.question_label: At what speed does the shudder happen?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: 30-45 mph is classic torque converter lockup shudder

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it happen with light throttle, heavy throttle, or both?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Light throttle = torque converter; heavy = clutch slip

symptom_questions.question_label: What does the shudder feel like?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Rumble strip feel is classic torque converter shudder

symptom_questions.question_label: Has the transmission fluid been changed recently?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Fresh fluid can sometimes resolve early shudder

symptom_questions.question_label: Do your brake lights work when you press the brake pedal?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Brake light switch is the most common cause

symptom_questions.question_label: Is there a shift lock release button near the shifter?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Manual release confirms shift interlock is the issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the shifter physically stuck or does it move but nothing happens?
options: Moves but car stays in park
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Stuck = interlock; moves = linkage or internal issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gear is it stuck in?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies linkage vs internal vs limp mode issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the shifter move to other positions?
options: Yes, but transmission doesn't change gears
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Shifter moves = linkage or internal; stuck = mechanical jam

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine or transmission warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Warning light suggests limp mode vs mechanical failure

symptom_questions.question_label: How would you describe the shifting?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Pattern helps identify sensor vs solenoid vs software issue

symptom_questions.question_label: When does this happen?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Consistent = sensor; random = intermittent electrical fault

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms stored codes for diagnosis

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gear causes the clunk?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Both = mounts; one = internal trans issue

symptom_questions.question_label: How loud is the clunk?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Severity indicates normal vs worn mounts vs internal damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the clunk worse when the engine is cold?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Cold clunk is often normal; hot clunk = wear

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you smell it?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing helps identify clutch burn vs overheating vs leak on exhaust

symptom_questions.question_label: Are you experiencing any other symptoms?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Multiple symptoms = severe internal damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the transmission fluid?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Burnt fluid confirms internal clutch damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Are you experiencing any transmission problems?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Symptoms help prioritize diagnosis and urgency

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine light flashing or steady?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Flashing = severe misfire or catalyst damage, not just trans

symptom_questions.question_label: When did the light come on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent onset helps correlate with driving events

symptom_questions.question_label: At what speed does the judder happen?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low speed = belt slip; highway = lockup or software

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it happen during acceleration, cruising, or both?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Acceleration = belt slip; cruising = software or lockup

symptom_questions.question_label: Has the CVT fluid been changed recently?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: CVT fluid service can resolve early judder issues

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gears are hard to shift into?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Specific gears = synchros; all = clutch or linkage

symptom_questions.question_label: How does the clutch pedal feel?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Soft = hydraulic issue; hard = cable or linkage

symptom_questions.question_label: Is it hard to shift when moving, stopped, or both?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Moving = synchros; stopped = clutch not releasing

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gears grind?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Specific gears = synchros; all = clutch not releasing

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it grind even when the clutch is fully pressed to the floor?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Grinding with clutch down = clutch not releasing or synchro damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Does reverse grind the most?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Reverse has no synchro, so grinding = clutch not releasing

symptom_questions.question_label: When does the clutch slip?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Slipping under load = worn clutch disc

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the RPMs rise without the car accelerating?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms clutch slip vs other drivetrain issues

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you smell burning when it slips?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Burning smell confirms clutch friction material overheating

symptom_questions.question_label: When does the chatter happen?
options: When releasing the clutch from a stop
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: From stop = clutch disc or mounts; shifting = different issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you feel vibration through the pedal or the whole car?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Pedal = clutch; whole car = mounts or flywheel

symptom_questions.question_label: Was the clutch replaced recently?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: New clutch chatter = installation issue or contamination

symptom_questions.question_label: At what speed does the shudder happen?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: 30-45 mph is classic torque converter lockup shudder

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it happen with light throttle or heavy throttle?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Light throttle = lockup clutch; heavy = different issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the shudder go away if you press the gas or let off?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Going away with throttle change confirms lockup issue

symptom_questions.question_label: When did you notice it won't downshift?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms kickdown vs general shift issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it downshift if you press the gas pedal all the way to the floor?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: No kickdown at WOT = throttle sensor or kickdown cable issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms throttle position sensor or transmission codes

symptom_questions.question_label: Which shifts have the RPM flare?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies specific clutch pack slipping

symptom_questions.question_label: How much do the RPMs spike?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Larger flare = more severe clutch wear

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the flare getting worse over time?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Progressive worsening = internal wear advancing

symptom_questions.question_label: When does it drop into neutral?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing helps identify sensor vs solenoid vs mechanical failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it go back into gear if you shift or restart the car?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Intermittent = electrical; permanent = mechanical failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine or transmission warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Warning light confirms stored codes for diagnosis

symptom_questions.question_label: How loud is the clunk?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Severity indicates normal vs worn mounts vs internal damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it also clunk when shifting into drive?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Both = mounts; reverse only = may be normal

symptom_questions.question_label: Is it worse when the engine is cold?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Cold clunk is often normal; hot clunk = wear

symptom_questions.question_label: When does the hunting happen?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Terrain-specific = throttle or load sensor issue

symptom_questions.question_label: At what speed does it hunt?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Speed range helps identify torque converter vs shift logic issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the check engine light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms sensor or solenoid codes

symptom_questions.question_label: How cold is it outside when this happens?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Extreme cold = normal; mild temps = fluid or internal issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it shift normally once warmed up?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Goes away = likely normal; persists = fluid or wear issue

symptom_questions.question_label: What type of shift issue?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Type of issue helps identify fluid vs mechanical problem

symptom_questions.question_label: How hot is it when the problem happens?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Heavy load = overheating; normal driving = internal wear

symptom_questions.question_label: What happens when hot?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Slipping when hot = worn clutches or seals

symptom_questions.question_label: Is there a transmission temperature warning light?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Warning light confirms overheating vs normal heat

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the battery warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms charging system fault vs customer assumption

symptom_questions.question_label: Are the lights dimming or flickering?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Indicates low voltage and confirms alternator vs battery issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you still drive the vehicle or does it stall?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and whether towing is needed

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear squealing from the engine?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Indicates loose or broken serpentine belt

symptom_questions.question_label: How long does the car sit before the battery dies?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Indicates severity of parasitic draw

symptom_questions.question_label: How old is the battery?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Old batteries can self-discharge vs true parasitic draw

symptom_questions.question_label: Are there any aftermarket accessories installed (alarm, stereo, lights)?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Aftermarket accessories are common sources of parasitic draw

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the car start with a jump?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Jump start success = battery issue; failure = starter issue

symptom_questions.question_label: How many clicks do you hear?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Single click = starter solenoid; rapid = low battery voltage

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the dashboard lights dim when you try to start?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Dimming lights confirm low battery voltage

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the dashboard lights come on when you turn the key?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: No lights = dead battery or connection; lights on = starter circuit issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the security or anti-theft light flashing?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Security system can prevent starting

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the shifter fully in Park (or clutch pedal pressed if manual)?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Neutral safety switch or clutch switch prevents starting if not engaged

symptom_questions.question_label: Which windows are not working?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: All windows = fuse or master switch; one window = motor or regulator

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the window stuck up or down?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Stuck down is higher priority for security and weather

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear any noise when you press the window button?
options: Motor noise but window doesn't move
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Motor noise = regulator; no noise = electrical; grinding = mechanical jam

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you tried replacing the key fob battery?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Dead fob battery is the most common and cheapest fix

symptom_questions.question_label: Which doors are affected?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: All doors = module or fob; one door = actuator

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the locks work manually with the key or inside button?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Manual works = electrical issue; manual fails = mechanical jam

symptom_questions.question_label: When do the lights flicker?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing helps identify alternator vs loose connection vs voltage regulator

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the battery warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Battery light confirms charging system issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the headlights also flicker or dim?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Headlights flickering confirms system-wide voltage issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Which headlights are not working?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Both = fuse or relay; one = bulb; high/low = switch or relay

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the parking lights and turn signals work?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Other lights working = headlight circuit specific issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you safely drive during daylight only?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and scheduling

symptom_questions.question_label: When did the horn stop working?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent failure may correlate with other work or events

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the airbag warning light on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Airbag light suggests clock spring failure which also affects horn

symptom_questions.question_label: Which wiper speeds don't work?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: All speeds = motor or power; specific speeds = resistor or switch

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear the wiper motor trying to run?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Motor noise = linkage jam; no noise = electrical issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you avoid driving in rain until fixed?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency for scheduling

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear the fuel pump prime when you turn the key on (before cranking)?
options: Not sure what to listen for
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: No prime sound = pump, relay, or fuse issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the engine crank but not start?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms fuel delivery issue vs starter issue

symptom_questions.question_label: How much fuel is in the tank?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low fuel can cause pump failure or starvation

symptom_questions.question_label: Which gauges are not working?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: All gauges = cluster or power issue; one gauge = sensor issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the warning lights still work?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Lights working = gauge-specific issue; lights out = cluster power issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the brakes still work normally?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms normal braking is intact, only ABS is affected

symptom_questions.question_label: When did the ABS light come on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent onset may correlate with tire change or other work

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you had any recent tire or brake work done?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent work may have damaged wheel speed sensor or wiring

symptom_questions.question_label: When did the airbag light come on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent onset may correlate with events or other work

symptom_questions.question_label: Has the vehicle been in an accident or impact recently?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Impact can trigger sensors or damage airbag components

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you done any work under the seats or on the steering wheel?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Work in these areas can disconnect airbag connectors

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the ABS light also on?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: ABS and traction share sensors, both on = wheel speed sensor likely

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the car drive differently?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Driving issues indicate active system problem vs stored code

symptom_questions.question_label: How high does the temperature gauge go?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Severity determines urgency and risk of engine damage

symptom_questions.question_label: When does it overheat?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Idle = fan issue; highway = coolant flow or thermostat

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the coolant level?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low coolant is the most common cause

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you see steam or smell coolant?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Steam indicates active leak or boiling coolant

symptom_questions.question_label: Where do you see the leak?
options: Under the front of the car
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Location helps identify radiator vs hose vs heater core

symptom_questions.question_label: How much coolant is leaking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and whether driving is safe

symptom_questions.question_label: What color is the fluid?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms coolant vs other fluids

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the car overheating?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Overheating confirms fan is needed and not working

symptom_questions.question_label: When did you notice the fan not running?
options: Not sure if it should be running
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Never runs = electrical; sometimes = sensor or relay

symptom_questions.question_label: What is the temperature gauge doing?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Stays cold = stuck open; too hot = stuck closed

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the heater blow hot air?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: No heat suggests stuck open thermostat or low coolant

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear grinding or squealing from the engine?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Noise indicates bearing failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Where is the coolant leaking from?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Leak at front of engine suggests water pump weep hole

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the engine overheating?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Overheating confirms pump not circulating coolant

symptom_questions.question_label: Does air blow from the vents?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: No air = blower issue; cold air = coolant or blend door issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the engine reach normal operating temperature?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Engine stays cold = stuck open thermostat

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the coolant level full?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low coolant prevents heater core from getting hot

symptom_questions.question_label: When does it overheat?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Highway overheating suggests restricted coolant flow

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you see debris or bugs blocking the radiator?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: External blockage is easy to clean vs internal clog

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you see white smoke from the exhaust?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: White smoke indicates coolant burning in combustion chamber

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the oil look milky or foamy?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Milky oil indicates coolant mixing with oil

symptom_questions.question_label: Has the engine overheated recently?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Overheating can cause head gasket failure

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the temperature gauge in the red?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms severe overheating

symptom_questions.question_label: Can you see coolant bubbling in the reservoir?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Visible bubbling confirms boiling or combustion gases

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you stopped driving the vehicle?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms customer has stopped to prevent engine damage

symptom_questions.question_label: Which hose is leaking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which hose to bring

symptom_questions.question_label: How bad is the leak?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines if temporary repair possible or needs tow

symptom_questions.question_label: Where does the temperature gauge sit?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Behavior helps identify sensor vs gauge vs wiring issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the other gauges work normally?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Other gauges failing suggests cluster issue vs sensor

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the passenger carpet wet?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Wet carpet confirms heater core leak

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you smell sweet coolant inside the car?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Sweet smell confirms coolant leak inside cabin

symptom_questions.question_label: Do the windows fog up with an oily film?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Oily fog on windows is classic heater core leak symptom

symptom_questions.question_label: Where does the clunking come from?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Narrows inspection area

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you hear the clunk?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing helps identify struts vs sway bar vs control arms

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the clunking getting worse?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Progressive worsening indicates wear vs stable issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Which end of the car feels bouncy?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which struts or shocks need replacement

symptom_questions.question_label: How many times does it bounce after hitting a bump?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: More than 2 bounces confirms worn dampers

symptom_questions.question_label: At what speed does the vibration occur?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Speed range helps identify balance vs alignment vs mechanical issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it vibrate when braking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Vibration when braking indicates warped rotors

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you had recent tire work or rotation?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent tire work suggests balance issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Which direction does it pull?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Direction helps identify which side has the issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked tire pressures?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Unequal tire pressure is the easiest fix

symptom_questions.question_label: Does it pull more when braking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Pull when braking indicates brake issue vs alignment

symptom_questions.question_label: How are the tires wearing?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Wear pattern indicates alignment issue type

symptom_questions.question_label: Which tires are wearing unevenly?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which corner has alignment or suspension issue

symptom_questions.question_label: How much play is in the steering wheel?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Amount of play indicates severity

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the car wander or require constant correction?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Wandering confirms loose steering components

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you feel safe driving the vehicle?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and whether towing is needed

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you checked the power steering fluid level?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Low fluid is the most common cause

symptom_questions.question_label: When is the steering hard?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing helps identify pump vs rack vs fluid issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Do you hear whining or groaning when turning?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Noise indicates pump or rack issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Where do you see the leak?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Location helps identify hose vs rack vs pump

symptom_questions.question_label: How much fluid is leaking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Determines urgency and whether driving is safe

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the steering getting hard?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Hard steering confirms low fluid from leak

symptom_questions.question_label: Which side squeaks?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which side to inspect

symptom_questions.question_label: When does it squeak?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Direction helps identify which component is worn

symptom_questions.question_label: What symptoms are you experiencing?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Multiple symptoms indicate severity

symptom_questions.question_label: Which side seems to have the issue?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which side to prioritize

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you hear the clunking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Timing helps identify which bushing is worn

symptom_questions.question_label: Does the car pull to one side or have uneven tire wear?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Worn bushings affect alignment

symptom_questions.question_label: Which side is clunking?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which link to replace

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you hear the clunk?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms sway bar link vs other suspension component

symptom_questions.question_label: Which side makes the noise?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Identifies which mount to replace

symptom_questions.question_label: When do you hear the noise?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Confirms strut mount vs other component

symptom_questions.question_label: Is the steering wheel off-center when driving straight?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Off-center steering confirms alignment issue

symptom_questions.question_label: Have you had recent suspension or tire work?
symptom_questions.helps_mechanic_with: Recent work often requires alignment
